heroes

Class Hero

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • heroes.Hero
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Hero
extends java.lang.Thread
    Represents a hero that controls himself in own thread.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Hero.MortalSins
      Represents all kinds of MortalSins, supported by the game ANGER:
      + makes hero more powerful
      - makes hero dangerous to everyone
      - less retreat chance
      - can make a mess in the Tower treat: Trainings, Poisons ENVY:
      + better use of infernal items
      + tends to gain XP
      - can deny working with high-leveled heroes
      - can betray his mate PRIDE:
      + better teaching
      + better learning spells
      + accepts more complicated quests
      - denies easy quests
      - tends to walk alone AVARICE:
      + better gaining items and money
      - doesn't share finding
      - easy to become possessed by demons LUST:
      + easier to make arrangements
      + can recruit rivals
      + can solve the conflicts with civilians
      - can be seduces by a rival
      - can harass mates GLUTTONY:
      + resistible to physical damage
      - useless versus quick enemies
      - always must be full before embarking

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

        java.lang.Thread.State, java.lang.Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler

    • Constructor Detail

      • Hero

        public Hero(MapGenerator mg)
        Creating new hero. Hero needs to be aware, on what map is he located So necessary to attach MapGenerator
        Parameters:
        mg - MapGenerator, linked to hero

      • setWalkCallback

        public void setWalkCallback(java.lang.Runnable walkCallback)
        Walk Callback is needed for internal messaging (e.g for renderer) When hero walks he sends a message, so other component can redraw him
        Parameters:
        walkCallback - callback that is to be assigned

      • preferLocation

        public final java.lang.Integer[] preferLocation(java.util.stream.Stream<javafx.util.Pair<Location,java.lang.Integer[]>> variants)
        hero can decide, where to go. in this method he gets a Stream pair and prefers where he wants to go
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • giveOrder

        public void giveOrder(java.lang.String order)
        here you can give order for a hero, that will be executed. orders can be recieved only in IDLE state you can't order, while hero is busy
        Parameters:
        order - command to execute
